resources.string: My City App
Categories
Recommended
Coffee Shops
Restaurants
Dog Friendly Restaurants
Dog Parks
Shopping Center
Mad Lab Coffee
Mad Lab Coffee was launched out of a basement in downtown LA

Mad Lab Coffee was launched out of a basement in downtown LA by creators Andrew Sinclair and Sarah Sinclair with a focus on quality and the neighborhood of Los Angeles. Mad Lab has become one of the most recognizable roasters in Los Angeles and the International coffee community focusing on quality, seasonal, and relational driven coffees. The focus for all of Mad Lab’s coffees is the pursuit of sweetness and fruitiness.
Open from 7am-6pm
6515 W Sunset Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90028
Laidrey Coffee
Stop by our cafe in Tarzana to sample our range of coffees alongside a menu of baked treats

Stop by our cafe in Tarzana to sample our range of coffees alongside a menu of baked treats, seasonal toasts, and more. We regularly host events throughout the month on our shop where we partner with local vendors, in addition to providing coffee bags, merchandise, and more for purchase in our cafe. We look forward to seeing you at Laidrey!
Open M-Sun 7am - 5pm
18600 Venture Blvd., Tarzana, CA 91356
10 Speed Coffee
Appealing to bicycle culture, this Calabasas and Santa Monica cafe does well-crafted espresso

Appealing to bicycle culture, this Calabasas and Santa Monica cafe does well-crafted espresso drinks and a light menu of teas and tonics to help cyclists to continue their routes. When in Santa Monica, the shop is a bright oasis to work or host in-person meetings or for a quick cup.
Open from 6am - 4pm
1919 Santa Monica Blvd.,Santa Monica, CA 90404
The Boy and the Bear
The Boy and the Bear is steadily moving on an expansion path with locations in Redondo Beach

The Boy and the Bear is steadily moving on an expansion path with locations in Redondo Beach, Westchester, Pasadena, Culver City, and a new cafe in Sherman Oaks. The warehouse-style interiors take on a cool, spacious, and serene vibe with plenty of well-crafted espresso drinks.
Open from 7am - 4pm
350 N Pacific Coast Hwy, Redondo Beach, CA 90277
Maru Coffee
An exercise in Korean minimalist design, Maru’s Los Feliz and the Arts District are incredibly pleasant places

An exercise in Korean minimalist design, Maru’s Los Feliz and the Arts District are incredibly pleasant places to enjoy coffee in Los Angeles. The beans are roasted at its larger Arts District space and the Beverly Hills is a recent addition to secure a cup in the city.
Open from 8am - 5pm
1936 Hillhurst Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90027
Orochon Ramen
Small Japanese restaurant with a Wall of Fame for diners who can conquer the spiciest ramen bowl.
Small Japanese restaurant with a Wall of Fame for diners who can conquer the spiciest ramen bowl.
Open Sun-Thur 11:30am - 10:30pm Friday and Saturday 11:30am - 11:00pm
123 Astronaut E S Onizuka St, Los Angeles, California 90012
Slurpin Ramen Bar
Staying traditional with style! Started in the heart of Koreatown

Staying traditional with style! Started in the heart of Koreatown, Los Angeles 8th Street, slurpin ramen was created from ambition to bringing authentic Hakata-style rich, thick and creamy tonkotsu ramen to California. slurpin’ derives from Japanese culture in showing respect to your ramen chef with a loud “slurp” sound from eating the noodles and broth. Loud slurping may seem different in the US, but in Japan it is considered rude not to slurp! Grab a bowl and let us hear you enjoy the great quality taste in every slurp!
Open everyday 11:30am - 12am
18508-A E Gale Ave city of Industry, CA 92748
Native Fields
With 100% locally sourced ingredients, we shop at the South Pasadena and Claremont farmers markets. We support local farmers

With 100% locally sourced ingredients, we shop at the South Pasadena and Claremont farmers markets. We support local farmers, like Underwood Family Farms, Valdivia Farm, Justin of Seeds of Xanxadu, and Cal Poly Pomona. Native Fields is a farm-to-table, non-GMO, pesticide-free restaurant and cafe. Grass-fed beef, free-range chicken and pasture-raised eggs are served here with vegetarian and vegan options available.
Open Sun - Tue 9am - 3pm, Wen - Sat 9am - 9pm
18750 Amar Rd, Walnut, CA 91789
The Chessecake Factory
With more than 250 items on our menu, it may be hard to believe

With more than 250 items on our menu, it may be hard to believe that we make things fresh and from scratch in each restaurant – but it’s true! Our prep kitchens are one of the busiest spots in our restaurants, and it’s where the magic begins every day.
Open M-th 11:30am - 10pm, Fri 11:30am - 11pm, Sat 11am - 11pm, Sun 10am - 10pm
189 The Grove Dr K-90, Los Angeles, CA 90036
Viva Madrid
Located in Claremont historic Village district, Viva Madrid has been serving authentic Spanish.
Located in Claremont historic Village district, Viva Madrid has been serving authentic Spanish flavors and experiences since
Open M-Th 5pm - 10pm, Fri 5pm - 11pm, Sat 4pm - 11pm, Sun 4pm - 9pm
225 N Yale Ave, Claremont, CA 91711
Little Sister DTLA
East-Meets-West dishes that inspire and evoke a feeling of being welcomed into Chef

"East-Meets-West dishes that inspire and evoke a feeling of being welcomed into Chef Vuong's home. Little Sister's menu showcases Chef Tin's take on one of the more interesting and rich collisions of food and culture that was borne out of the European colonization of Southeast Asia. Dishes blend and balance the spices and flavors of Southeast Asia with French techniques and Dutch and British colonial influences. The menu is continually and progressively evolving, reflecting the inspiration and the seasons. Chef Tin curates the restaurant's wine and beverage program with a focus on intriguing labels, both domestically and from around the world."
Open M-F 11am - 10pm, S-Sun 11am - 10pm
523 W 7th St, Los Angeles, CA 90017
Mama Por Dios
Mamá por Dios is a restaurant that highlights the best of México, with its flavors

Mamá por Dios is a restaurant that highlights the best of México, with its flavors, aromas, colors, traditions and art. Bringing it closer to its customers and every drink in every corner. Mamá por Dios is a Mexican gourmet restaurant where you can celebrate every moment to the sound of live Mariachi or enjoy a shot to the beats of a great DJ.
Open Brunch M-Thu 10am - 2pm, Dinner 5pm - 12pm, Fri 11am - 2pm, Sat 10am - 2pm, Sun 10am - 12am
12225 E. Foothill Blvd. Rancho Cucamonga, CA. 91739
Pedalers Fork
Even though Pedalers Fork has deep roots in Los Angeles’s bike culture, it’s also an ideal spot to bring pups.

Even though Pedalers Fork has deep roots in Los Angeles’s bike culture, it’s also an ideal spot to bring pups. The Calabasas space can provide options if there for a quick coffee stop, or with a full sit-down meal including brisket, maple chili chicken wings, and a hot chicken sandwich.
Coffee Shop 6am - 3pm, Lunch M - 8am - 1pm, Tue - Fri 8am - 3pm, Weekend Brunch 8am- 2:30pm
23504 Calabasas Rd, Calabasas, CA 91302
"Tallula's"
Tallula’s in Santa Monica was always one of Los Angeles’s more dog-friendly spaces

Tallula’s in Santa Monica was always one of Los Angeles’s more dog-friendly spaces (maybe even friendlier than most, with employees consistently coming over to give dog-friends ample treats and love). But with the addition of its new-ish Sunday dog brunch, now a full-time dog menu offered seven days a week, it’s reached a new tier. Dogs can feast on watermelon bites, chicken tacos, and the “wolf’s feast,” a bowl of raw grass-fed hanger steak with steamed vegetables.
CLOSED
118 Entrada Dr. Santa Monica, CA 90402
Sugar Palm Ocean Avenue
The Viceroy in Santa Monica is as pet-friendly as it comes, and recently launched

The Viceroy in Santa Monica is as pet-friendly as it comes, and recently launched an actual pet menu on Saturdays and Sundays from 6:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. That includes a puppy scramble with eggs, spinach, and shredded chicken, or the Snoop Doggy Dog with CBD oil, almond milk, peanut butter, and banana.
Brunch 6:30am - 3:00pm, Dinner 3:00pm - 10:0pm
1819 Ocean Avenue, Santa Monica, California 90401
Hermanito
Sawtelle’s best dog-friendly spot is Hermanito: The owner converted the side

Sawtelle’s best dog-friendly spot is Hermanito: The owner converted the side driveway and rear parking lot into new dining areas (including doggy doors for the “perros”), and it’s something to behold. The tables keep ample space between them, leaving plenty of room to bring dogs while eating the five-spice duck with a cocktail.
2024 Sawtelle Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90025
Highly Likely Cafe
This all-day cafe in West Adams is the platonic ideal for unrushed, unequivocally easy weekday

This all-day cafe in West Adams is the platonic ideal for unrushed, unequivocally easy weekday and weekend breakfasts. Dogs will appreciate the love and attention from staff members, who are highly likely to pet them or pass on treats as they walk by to drop off squishy-roll bodega breakfast sandwiches and flaky chocolate croissants.
Hours 8am - 9pm Daily
4310 W Jefferson Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90016
Momed
Momed boasts its very own mascot, Piper, who is often roaming

Momed boasts its very own mascot, Piper, who is often roaming the grounds of this Middle Eastern hot spot in Atwater Village. Bring friends to keep her company on the spacious shaded patio, and enjoy some of mezze, cocktails, and kabobs to boot.

Lunch - Tuesday to Friday 11:30am to 2:30pm, Brunch - Saturday and Sunday 10am to 3pm, Dinner - Sunday to Thursday 5pm to 9:30pm, Dinner - Friday and Saturday 5pm to 10pm, Happy Hour - Monday to Thursday 5pm to 6:30pm
3425 Casitas Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90039
The Boneyard
The Boneyard is open each day from sunrise until 10:00 pm. This off-leash dog park is located within

The Boneyard is open each day from sunrise until 10:00 pm. This off-leash dog park is located within a large park and features a small and large dog park area, benches, trees, and water fountains in just over a little more than an acre. Decomposed granite is used as ground cover. And don’t forget, dogs must be licensed, vaccinated, and over the age of four months.
Sunrise until 10:00pm
Duquesne Ave. and Jefferson Blvd., Culver City, CA 90232
Arts District Dog Park
The Arts District Dog Park is a small-ish, private, non-profit dog park and has longer hours than most other dog parks

The Arts District Dog Park is a small-ish, private, non-profit dog park and has longer hours than most other dog parks. It is open daily from 5:00 am to 11:00 pm. Additionally, you’ll find a dog water fountain, a separate area for small dogs, shade trees, and benches. The ground cover is made up of a decomposed granite surface. Visiting dogs must be at least four months old and up-to-date with licenses and vaccines.
Daily 5:00am to 11:00pm
1004 E. 4th St., Los Angeles, CA 90013
Bluff Creek Dog Park
You’ll find Bluff Creek Dog Park in the Playa Vista neighborhood of Los Angeles.

You’ll find Bluff Creek Dog Park in the Playa Vista neighborhood of Los Angeles. The park is open seven days a week (opening at 7:00 am Monday through Friday, 8:00 am on Saturday and Sunday, and closing at dusk). Bluff Creek is the only dog park in Playa Vista that offers “pet turf” in contrast to the wood chips you’ll find at other parks. You’ll also find “rolling hills” and a central stream
Mon- Fri 7:00am to dusk, Sat- Sun 8:00am to dusk
12604 Bluff Creek Dr., Los Angeles, CA 90094
Griffith Park Dog Park
The Griffith Park Dog Park is open daily from sunrise to sunset, although it does close each Tuesday from 6:00 am to 10:00 am for maintenance.

The Griffith Park Dog Park is open daily from sunrise to sunset, although it does close each Tuesday from 6:00 am to 10:00 am for maintenance. This 1.6-acre dog park tends to be most popular with families “in the know” and so doesn’t tend to get as crowded as other parks. You’ll find separate fenced-off areas for small and large dogs, shaded sitting areas, and picnic tables. No grass here, which can make clean-up easier. A visit to Griffith Park Dog Park can also be included into a whole day spent in Griffith Park and its many family-friendly attractions!
Daily from sunrise to sunset
North end of the John Ferraro Soccer Field on N. Zoo Dr., Los Angeles, CA 90027
Sepulveda Basin Off leash Dog Park
The Dog Park is open daily from sunrise to sunset, though it is closed each Fridayn

The Dog Park is open daily from sunrise to sunset, though it is closed each Friday from 6:00 am to 11:00 am for regular maintenance. Families will enjoy this 6.5-acre dog park which offers two small dog runs and one large dog run. You’ll also find lots of trees providing shade as well as benches and chairs. The site also hosts a low-cost Vaccine Clinic each Sunday from 3:30 pm to 5:00 pm.
Daily from sunrise to sunset
17550 Victory Blvd., Encino, CA 91406
Lake Hollywood Park
The Lake Hollywood Park boasts a children’s play area, picnic tables, barbecue pits

The Lake Hollywood Park boasts a children’s play area, picnic tables, barbecue pits, and an incredible view of the Hollywood sign. In addition, the park is dog-friendly though dogs must remain on leashes. The park is open seven days a week from sunrise to sunset. (Keep in mind the area can get crowded due to visitors trying to catch a glimpse of the Hollywood sign).
Daily from sunrise to sunset
3160 Canyon Lake Dr., Los Angeles, CA
Silver Lake Dog Park
The Silver Lake Dog Park is open seven days a week, from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm.

The Silver Lake Dog Park is open seven days a week, from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm. (Note that the park closes each Wednesday from 6:00 am to 8:30 am for regular maintenance). Dogs will enjoy running off-leash at this fenced-in park which has a separate area for smaller pets. Regularly visiting families speak highly of the friendly dogs and dog owners you’ll encounter here, the biggest complaint is the lack of grass.
Daily from 6:00am to 10:00pm
1863 Silve Lake Blvd., Los Angeles, CA 90026
Runyon Canyon Dog Park
Families who enjoy hiking Runyon Canyon will appreciate the convenience of the Runyon

Families who enjoy hiking Runyon Canyon will appreciate the convenience of the Runyon Canyon Dog Park. The dog park is open daily from sunrise to sunset. Families will find beautiful walking trails providing scenic views of our city. There are separate fenced-off areas for small and large dogs. Keep in mind that this is a popular spot, and as is common in Los Angeles, parking can be a challenge sometimes.
Daily from sunrise to sunset
2000 N. Fuller Ave., Los Angeles, CA 90046
Victoria Gardens
The Victoria Gardens Cultural Center, which features the Rancho Cucamonga

The Victoria Gardens Cultural Center, which features the Rancho Cucamonga Public Library, a performing arts center, and a multi-use reception hall, is owned and operated by the city of Rancho Cucamonga and sits north of the shopping center between the two parking structures
Mon- Thu 10:00am to 8:00pm, Fri- Sat 10:00am to 9:00pm and Sun 11:00am to 7:00pm
12505 North Mainstreet Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91739
Ontario Mills
Ontario Mills is a shopping and outlet mall located in Ontario, California

Ontario Mills is a shopping and outlet mall located in Ontario, California, within the Los Angeles metropolitan area. With 28 million annual visitors, it is one of the top shopping and tourist destinations in California.
10:00am to 9:00pm
1 Mills Cir, Ontario, CA 91764
The Grove
High-end shopping mall features trendy retailers
High-end shopping mall features trendy retailers, restaurants and a theater amid a bustling promenade.
189 The Groove Dr, Los Angeles, CA 90036
South Coast Plaza
South Coast Plaza is a modern shopping hub in the heart of Orange County, attracting those seeking upscale boutiques,

South Coast Plaza is a modern shopping hub in the heart of Orange County, attracting those seeking upscale boutiques, designer labels, and award-winning cuisine. With one of the greatest concentrations of high-fashion retailers, rivaling the trendsetting neighborhoods of Bond Street, London and Fifth Avenue, New York, you are bound to leave with a celebrity-worthy wardrobe. With a cascading multitier fountain as its centerpiece, the 3-floor shopping mall is designed in a wonky H-shape, with 2 parking neighborhoods and a V.I.P. concierge service. Department stores are positioned around the perimeter, while boutique shops are grouped by product. High-end jewelers call Jewel Court home, while Carousel Court is where you go for hip, big-name apparel options.
Mon- Fri from 10:00am to 9:00pm Sat 10:00am to 8:00pm, Sun 11:00am to 6:30pm
3333 Bristol Street, Costa Mesa, CA 92626
Hollywood and Highland
There is never a dull moment on Hollywood Boulevard and the same goes for the shopping at Hollywood and Highland

There is never a dull moment on Hollywood Boulevard and the same goes for the shopping at Hollywood and Highland. Boasting iconic tourist attractions such as the TCL Chinese Theatre, the Dolby Theatre and the Walk of Fame, this mall offers just as much gravy in its range of shops. Familiar favorites include Gap, American Eagle and LA’s only Virgin Megastore, as well as smaller chains like Swatch, Bebe and Hot Topic. If you’re looking to take something back home, the mall also has excellent souvenir shops. Though Hollywood and Highland may be crowded, its easily understandable thanks to its legendary status.
Mon- Sat 10:00am to 10:00pm, Sun from 10:00am to 8:00pm
6801 Hollywood Boulevard 170, Los Angeles, CA 90028
Santa Monica Place
With Santa Monica Place just blocks from the beach, a dip in the ocean and a trip to the shops became just as easy

With Santa Monica Place just blocks from the beach, a dip in the ocean and a trip to the shops became just as easy. Worth mentioning is its sleek, modern open-air design which involves a rooftop dining deck with chef-driven restaurants and stunning views of the city, the mountains and the Pacific. The mall has shops that range from Louis Vuitton Ted Baker to Bloomingdale’s and Nordstrom. But the experience is made all the more special with the mall’s superb dining options and a state-of-the-art 12-screen movie theater experience… you could spend a few days here
Mon- Sat from 10:00am to 9:00pm, Sun from 11:00am to 8:00pm
395 Santa Monica Place, Santa Monica, CA 90401
Location:
Back
